titleStmt.title: Electricity and Water-Cooling in the Past
TUNOCENT Dataset
titleStmt.funder: Funded by the FWF Austrian Science Fund under the number P 31647

publicationStmt.distributor: Austrian Center for Digital Humanities and Cultural Heritage

media.desc: The informant has not explicitly agreed to the publication of the audio recording. Thus, the audio recording is available only to the research project itself.

monogr.title: The Arabic Variety of Nefza (Northwest Tunisia): Phonology, Morphology and Texts

biblStruct.note: This PhD thesis provides a comprehensive description of the phonology and morphology of the hitherto undescribed Arabic variety spoken in the Northwest Tunisian Nefza region, with a selection of transcribed and translated texts attached. The linguistic corpus of ~ 50,000 words is based on data collected during three field research stays in the Nefza region within the scope of the TUNOCENT project, which examines the hitherto undescribed Northwest and Central Tunisian Bedouin type Arabic varieties. The data, consisting of both questionnaires and narrative texts, have been collected in the town of Nefza, as well as in the five surrounding villages Touila, Umm Labid, Zaga, Ouled Bou Ali and Hbeba.The description includes linguistic variation based on the speaker’s age, gender and origin. Moreover, comparative remarks on geographically adjacent and linguistically cognate Arabic varieties, such as the prestigious sedentary variety of Tunis and the South Tunisian Bedouin type variety of Douz are made.According to W. Marçais’ (1950) classification of Tunisian Bedouin type Arabic varieties as the so called Sulaym type and Hilāl type varieties, Nefza Arabic should belong to the northern group of Sulaym type varieties. In the final part of this thesis W. Marçais’ Sulaym–Hilāl division of Tunisian Bedouin type varieties is reevaluated by investigating the degree of correspondence of the linguistic features listed by W. Marçais as typical for Sulaym type varieties with actual Nefza Arabic features.

prefixDef.p: Private URIs using the teiCorpusHeader prefix are pointers to any element in the TUNOCENT teiCorpus document.
Private URIs using the arche prefix are pointers to resources archived in the long-term repository ARCHE.
Private URIs using the assets prefix are pointers to assets used by the TUNOCENT web application.
Private URIs using the datatypes.vicav.fl prefix are pointers to feature lists.
Private URIs using the datatypes.vicav.st prefix are pointers to VICAV sample texts.
Private URIs using the datatypes.tunocent.ums prefix are pointers to transcribed texts of unmonitored speech.
Private URIs using the datatypes.tunocent.pp prefix are pointers to TUNOCENT place profiles.
